caption: CIS Benchmark Detail
description: The CIS Benchmark Detail object contains information as defined by the Center for Internet Security (CIS) benchmarks. A CIS Benchmark provides technical guidance for securely configuring IT systems, software, networks, and cloud infrastructure.
name: cis_benchmark_detail

rule.description: The Rule object containing details about the CIS Benchmark check. This includes the rule name (e.g., Ensure mounting of cramfs filesystems is disabled), uid (the unique CIS identifier, e.g., 1.1.1.1), description (detailed explanation of the security requirement), and version information.

severity.description: The CIS Benchmark recommendation level as defined in the source document. Valid values are: Level 1 (security-forward, essential settings), Level 2 (security-focused environment, more restrictive), or Scored/Not Scored (whether compliance can be automatically checked).

severity_id.description: The normalized severity identifier that maps CIS Benchmark levels to standard severity levels. Level 2 maps to 4 (High), Level 1 maps to 3 (Medium).

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Maps to CIS Benchmark Level 1 - Essential security settings recommended for all systems.

4.caption: High
4.description: Maps to CIS Benchmark Level 2 - More restrictive and security-focused settings for sensitive environments.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.
